org.beiter.michael.crypto4j.primitives

Class MessageDigestUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.beiter.michael.crypto4j.primitives.MessageDigestUtil

  • public final class MessageDigestUtil
extends Object
    This class provides utility methods for common message digest operations, namely on String and byte[] payloads. The methods use object pools to potentially improve performance of the JCA operations required to obtain the JCA objects.

    See MessageDigestFactory.getPooledInstance(MessageDigestSpec, PoolSpec) for more information about how the pooling mechanism works.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods

      This method computes a message digest for the provided payload, using the provided message digest spec.
      static byte[] getBytes(String payload, MessageDigestSpec mdSpec, PoolSpec poolSpec)
      This method computes a message digest for the provided payload, using the provided message digest spec and pool configuration.

    • Method Detail

      • getBytes

        public static byte[] getBytes(String payload,
                              MessageDigestSpec mdSpec)
                       throws FactoryException,
                              NoSuchAlgorithmException
        This method computes a message digest for the provided payload, using the provided message digest spec.

        The method is using an internal pool to avoid the JCA bottlenecks and improve performance on repeated invocations. See MessageDigestFactory.getPooledInstance(MessageDigestSpec, PoolSpec) for more information about how the pooling mechanism works. This method will extract the pool configuration from the "additional properties" of the provided MessageDigestSpec object (see PoolSpec for valid pool configuration options). If no pool configuration can be extracted, then this method will use the defaults as specified in PoolSpec.

        Before the message digest is computed, the String is normalized using the Normalizer.Form.NFC form. The method also assumes that the String is encoded as UTF-8 . If your application provides String in a different encoding, or requires a different form of normalization, then use the getBytes(byte[], MessageDigestSpec) method instead.

        Parameters:
        payload - The data to compute the MD for
        mdSpec - The MD spec to use
        Returns:
        The message digest (hash) of the payload
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - When payload, poolSpec, or mdSpec are null
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - When the hash algorithm is not available
        FactoryException - When the configured provider is not registered in the security provider list, or when the pool operation fails
        IllegalStateException - When the pool is reset in parallel thread, while the current thread tries to access it and borrow an object from the pool

      • getBytes

        public static byte[] getBytes(byte[] payload,
                              MessageDigestSpec mdSpec)
                       throws FactoryException,
                              NoSuchAlgorithmException
        This method computes a message digest for the provided payload, using the provided message digest spec.

      • getBytes

        public static byte[] getBytes(String payload,
                              MessageDigestSpec mdSpec,
                              PoolSpec poolSpec)
                       throws FactoryException,
                              NoSuchAlgorithmException
        This method computes a message digest for the provided payload, using the provided message digest spec and pool configuration. See MessageDigestFactory.getPooledInstance(MessageDigestSpec, PoolSpec) for more information about how the pooling mechanism works.

        Before the message digest is computed, the String is normalized using the Normalizer.Form.NFC form. The method also assumes that the String is encoded as UTF-8 . If your application provides String in a different encoding, or requires a different form of normalization, then use the getBytes(byte[], MessageDigestSpec, PoolSpec) method instead.

        Parameters:
        payload - The data to compute the MD for
        mdSpec - The MD spec to use
        poolSpec - The pool spec to use
        Returns:
        The message digest (hash) of the payload
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - When payload, poolSpec, or mdSpec are null
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - When the hash algorithm is not available
        FactoryException - When the configured provider is not registered in the security provider list, or when the pool operation fails
        IllegalStateException - When the pool is reset in parallel thread, while the current thread tries to access it and borrow an object from the pool
